name: Spicy Pepper Beef
ingredients: 2 pounds top sirloin steak, sliced thinly across the grain

instructions.en: Put the sliced beef in a zipper bag and add the marinade (soy sauce and pepper). Marinate in the refrigerator for 30 minutes to 1 hour.
Heat 2 tablespoons of oil in a large nonstick skillet or wok over medium-high heat.
Add the ginger and crushed red pepper. Cook and stir for 5 seconds.
Add the beef and marinade. Stir-fry just until the meat is no longer pink, about 1-2 minutes. Remove the beef and keep warm.
Add the peppers and onions to the pan with the remaining tablespoon of oil. Cook until tender-crisp, 1-2 minutes.
Return the beef to the pan; stir in the Splenda, salt, pepper and sesame oil.
Optional: To thicken the sauce, push the meat and peppers to one side of the pan. Sprinkle the xanthan gum over the meat. Quickly stir it in and toss everything together.

notes: This recipe makes about 6 servings. Do not freeze. The sauce should thicken by serving time without further cooking if xanthan gum is used.
